questions.question_text: An incident responder was able to recover a binary file through the network traffic. The binary file was also found in some machines with anomalous behavior. Which of the following processes most likely can be performed to understand the purpose of the binary file?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I'm going with C because:
- Reverse engineering is a common answer to CySa+ practice questions pertaining to investigating binary files
- I haven't seen anything in my study material, nor the objectives, regarding "File Debugging."
- ChatGPT (o1 model) said the answer is C, Reverse Engineering

Selected Answer: A
file debugging for a file binary makes the sense to me. I would like to hear why it could be reverse engineering but i think it would too hard when file debugging can be used.

choices.B: Increase the system resources for vulnerable devices to prevent denial of service.
choices.A: Enforce strict network segmentation to isolate vulnerable systems from the production network.
choices.C: Perform penetration testing to verify the exploitability of these vulnerabilities.
choices.D: Develop in-house patches to address these vulnerabilities.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A makes the most sense to segment from everything as best as you can when it is highly exploitable vulnerabilities. I think this is a obvious one.

questions.question_text: A manufacturing companyâ€™s assembly line machinery only functions on an end-of-life OS. Consequently, no patches exist for several highly exploitable OS vulnerabilities. Which of the following is the best mitigating control to reduce the risk of these current conditions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
pretty simple one, TTL (time to live) of packets or request will die before they get to you and time zone difference may lock you out

questions.question_text: Which of the following will most likely cause severe issues with authentication and logging?

Several critical bugs were identified during a vulnerability scan. The SLA risk requirement is that all critical vulnerabilities should be patched within 24 hours. After sending a notification to the asset owners, the patch cannot be deployed due to planned, routine system upgrades. Which of the following is the best method to remediate the bugs?

choices.B: Request an exception to exclude the patch from installation.
choices.A: Reschedule the upgrade and deploy the patch.
choices.D: Notify the incident response team and rerun the vulnerability scan.
choices.C: Update the risk register and request a change to the SLA.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
"Several critical bugs" were found and the "SLA risk requirement is....critical vulnerabilities should be patched within 24 hours." the answer is to reschedule updates and prioritize the patching.

Selected Answer: D
D. Legal.

Here's why:

Legal Obligations & Privilege: Immediately involving the legal team is crucial to understand the company's legal and regulatory obligations (like GDPR, CCPA, state breach notification laws, etc.). Communications under the direction of legal counsel may also be protected by attorney-client privilege, which is vital during investigations and potential litigation.
Guiding the Response: The legal team will guide the entire incident response process, including advising on internal investigations, evidence preservation, coordination with forensic teams, determining notification requirements, and managing liability.
Coordinating Other Communications: Legal counsel will advise on when and how to contact other parties, including law enforcement, public relations, regulators, and affected customers.

Selected Answer: D
The legal team should be contacted first to ensure that the company responds appropriately, remains compliant with applicable laws, and avoids exacerbating the situation legally. They will then help coordinate the involvement of other teams, such as public relations or law enforcement, as needed.

Selected Answer: B
I believe it is B as it involves proactive engagement with stakeholders, including customers, employees, regulators, and the media.

questions.question_text: A company is in the middle of an incident, and customer data has been breached. Which of the following should the company contact first?
